availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Wholesale dry goods business in St. Louis, Missouri. Laid out the town of Glencoe, Missouri, c1854. Owners: James Woods, William T. Christy, Robert K. Woods, William T. Gentry, and Andrew Woods.

ab.bibl:
"Villainous Mail Robberies," Boon’s Lick Times (Fayette, Missouri), October 28, 1843, 2.
"Trustee’s Sale," Lancaster Excelsior (Lancaster, Missouri), November 19, 1870, 2.
"Historical Notes of Communities in the Meramec Valley," Meramec Valley Transcript (Pacific, Missouri), July 27, 1934, p. 1.
